conclusion: Analyze the motion of the bullets and the carts.
Bullets are fired from Cart A with a speed v0 relative to the ground.
Bullets travel horizontally and hit the target on Cart B.
Cart A moves to the left with speed v1.
Cart B moves to the right with speed v2.
Bullets are fired every Δt0 time interval.
Each bullet hits the target when the next bullet is fired.
Distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is s.
Relative speed of the bullets with respect to Cart B is v0 + v2.
Time taken for a bullet to travel the distance s is t = s / (v0 + v2).
Bullets are fired every Δt0, so the time interval between two bullets hitting the target is also Δt0.
Time for a bullet to travel the distance s should be equal to the time interval between firing: Δt0 = s / (v0 + v2).
Rearrange the equation to solve for s: s = (v0 + v2) Δt0.
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is s = (v0 + v2) Δt0.
